comments.body: Maybe an item or block that you can place to prevent spawning in an area, or maybe a potion that decreases the spawn rate
Moved excess out of header to make it easier to search. Thanks for your contribution.

Clarified subject to help search results and better clarify what's being talked about here.

Thanks for your contribution.
maybe you find spellbooks?
Great idea it could have a yellow mooshroom resembling the yellow flower cow in Minecraft earth
some mushrooms should poison you to.
Each mushroom should have it's own effect.

Hey, how about in the nether, or maybe the overworld AND the nether?

Also, what if it had a new mob, maybe gold geese, that drop golden eggs that sometimes give you gold nuggets when thrown.

Plus, what if there were golden flowers: Goldenbells. These could could be crafted with an iron nugget to make a gold nugget.

And the Piglins would like the gold geese, goldenbells and golden eggs.
Yes I was thinking something like a crater or special valley type thing where these generate
i saw a post about blue nether warts (if i didnt find it, i would make it myself), and i think this is the place they should go

Sense some ruined nether portals are spawning below the lava ocean maybe it would be logical for them to spawn inside such a lava temple. However doing anything underlava still isn't really doable sense you can't see, they would need to add a way to actually see underwater to add something like this 

 

Edit: I've seen some ideas of bringing back the nether reactor as a nether conduit for just somthing like this? It could be a good pairing considering the parallels to the ocean monument. tho maybe it shouldn't be a lava temple? Sense there is already a jungle temple? Maybe... the lava... um.. well a word that means travel or road? Sense there might be a ruined nether portal inside it?

This is great. I was going to suggest something like this but then I found your post. It would be nice to see the temples spawn with the upper part of the temple sticking out of the lava lakes in order to spot them and they could be "excavated" by using sand just like in the ocean temples.
By the way, that would be pretty interesting. Why not really add such a biom?
That would be prime build site material right there
Basalt is in the game yay :) but it's a nether only feature :(
This biome could appear in Nether now

when it rains, it should rain up, down, and to the sides, since the end is an island dimension and doesnt have an exact "up" even though gravity only goes one way, this also means they should add clouds at a high level and a low level, and the clouds should be purple, now this "rain" wouldn't be water because enderman are allergic to water, it would make the ground slipery because its rock, which would be a challenge for climbing from island to island, the wind thing you mentioned is kinda weird, but i think it should be implemented, but as in ocationaly you go up 1 or 2 blocks, or down 1 or 2 blocks if your in the air, which isn't crazy to say because of shulkers, and there should also be this weird rain that rain's "end slimes" up and down, it would be weird, but the entire dimension is weird so why not.
How about rare acid rain that appears randomly and could float upward or in some strange orientation.
This would definitely make the End a more interesting location.
End tornado!
I still think some dimensions should be added if it is very clear that Minecraft will benefit greatly, but other than that, I totally agree.
I agree with Bilbo.
@bilbobaggins how would new dimensions benefit minecraft

Your post is geared towards the vanilla survival side of Minecraft. But you left out the custom content side. Map makers often struggle to make there maps work because of limited dimensions with limited laws. In short, each dimension can have its own custom laws (changing game rules, Gravity, different sky boxes) and with only 3 dimensions it limits the tools at their disposal.
We don't need new vanilla dimensions as much as we need the option to add dimensions.

That said I still agree with Bilbo. New dimensions for survival could still be added but are not absolutely necessary.
I don't know.  It depends on the dimension.
@mcexplorer maybe Mojang could give mapmakers tools to make dimensions like how they made data packs for mapmakers
The Aether would be a cool feature to have in Minecraft:PS4 Edition
yes there should be more added to the nether in terms of bobs and structures because there are currently only 5 mobs in the nether. perhaps there should be a lava mob and it spits fire at you
Why would you want a stop in people making more dimensions?! That is such a disturbing thought to even have.
We need more Dimensions like the heaven diension, and Sky dimension

I agree in that I think that updates should focus on current dimensions before adding new ones, but I do think that new dimensions should still be an option. The nether and end need more content, yes, but preventing additional dimensions would also lose some potential.
I love the new grafics
This sounds like a mod,but I like the idea
Yes it should added into minecraft i knew armor
Add new mobs that are evil
that a good Idea

Yah it's more like a mod but if more stabilized and give the sneaky Minecraft vibe it can be a great thing for end update but not good for overworld and I hope Mojang won't show this generation the end update
Love it!!
This, the rivers need a serius rework
They should have varying Hight levels like cave lakes will.
I think this is a great idea, but I'm not sure about the entry point...maybe there's an obtainable item in the Overworld you could use to jump into the Shadow Realm? IDK...

Maybe when you defeat the ender dragon a corrupted portal would appear and take you to the shadow realm . However the corrupted portal only appears sometimes so that way there would be a reason to respawn the enderdragon . Also maybe only part of the portal would be corrupted that way you could go back to the regular overworld or the shadow realm . Jumping into the void just sounds dangerous .
Maybe there could also be more mobs than just the ones you mentioned.

I think I would play Minecraft a lot more if this happened! I also have a suggestion for it, maybe have a corrupted shadow in a corrupted part of the dimension,also ghost blocks too. I would love ghost blocks in minecraft (ghost blocks are blocks you can walk through but look like solid blocks)
they should add a moon/heaven dimension.
They should add a reverse dimension, so that passive mobs would be hostile, and hostile mobs passive!
i don't know how to go to that dimension i am in pc.
Yes deffinetley needs new dimensions but I'm not so sure about the ants.I think it would make it too easy to get there
YES
Apart from the shark thing, you got it in the right spot. Good luck with your idea. :)

I really like this idea, maybe it could also add jellyfish and stingrays?

I'm not so sure on the hippocampus as an item, but I like it as a tameable mob... maybe the dragon drops an item you can use to tame the hippocampus?

Perhaps the serpent simply keeps a herd of hippocampi, so you have to kill it to get them. (Unless you're a really good aquatic horse rustler.)

Also, having these levels might take a change in how deep below sea level an ocean can extend. I just rode my skeleton horse across the bottom of the deep sea and it really wasn't all that deep. I think there is room beneath the current ocean depth limit, though. There just wouldn't be as much room for caves.

Another thought, where there is more pressure mobs not adapted would move more slowly. Also, scuba gear is pretty high tech, I would suggest something magical, perhaps made of prismarine.
Sa apporterai une bonne variété de grotte je trouve , sa serait moins classique au moins . J'aime beaucoup l'idée
The light spores, the fortresses, and new trees are a great idea, but the rest is bonkers. Maybe inside the fortresses there could be villagers or pillagers with a chest.
A cool theme for some type of dungeon too
There needs to at least be underground trees. Having a cave mode survival run is impossible without access to mines atm. Plus no natural structure can spawn inside of caves

I think instead it would be cool to rarely get caves below the surface of forest biomes that are like "open air" spaces where roots from the trees above break through the roof of the cave, so a bunch of logs will cover the roof of a cave.
I think a dimension would be better for this than a biome.

I agree with William Miller. Unless it’s an extremely rare biome in the nether, a new dimension would be more practical. I’m always in support of dragon feedback though. The dimension could have different biomes that could have different dragons. That way it would be more balanced.
I like dragons too, I love them so much I made one that would be about armour for players that is a dragon armour.
Wow! I think this would be such an awesome edition to the game!
Thank you.
This is exactly what would make the game way better again it would make me start playing agian
This would be good for a mod, not an update.  I am sure there is a a mythology mod out there for PC, and I’m pretty sure there is a mythology add-on for PE.

@Bilbo Baggins There is a mod that adds Mythology to Minecraft it adds different Mythology creatures like Cyclops, Sirens, Medusa, Pegasus, Hippocampus, And many more, but that's on Pc not Xbox, Ps4 and ps3 and many more devices. In Minecraft Vanilla there are tridents from a Greek god, but there should be a Greek creature at least one, like why would Mojang add a trident with no Greek god or creature or mob. Also the mod is called Ice and fire.
I really like greek mythology so I think this is a really good idea

I was thinking maybe we could make a biome called cyan biome. It's quite simple actually it just is cyan everything beds, clothes for villagers, even the players themselves turn cyan. how does that sound?
FartherTrain That sounds quite insane to be honest. I don't see the purpose.
good ideas...

I like some of the concepts. I think this is good inspiration for an end update. I think if they did one though, it would be inspired by minecraft dungeons Echoing Void DLC. If they added an ore, I think it can be an additive for any armor type when if you get to low health or something, it teleports you away from the mobs that put you that low of health. Giving you time to heal. And yes. Leaving the end empty is preferred. But with limited lushness. Rare lush biomes. And update the terrain to have more verticality and add 1 or two more structures with different rare loot

I think the idea of a barren end it more accurate to its current form and unlike the nether, i think it should stay that way but with a few biomes. The idea of few lush biomes and could even add end versions of villagers/piglins in lively end citys, they could even add fallen end ships with broken elytra instead of regular for more variety. Also End armor could be an alternative to netherite being the same way applied to diamond with an "endite smithing upgrade" and "endite" ingots but do diffrent things. The netherite being bulky and as said by the original poster, the end one could teleport you but is less powerful.
Pretty good ideas buddy, It's worth reading ur ideas.
I think that would be great. Add a new perspective to the game. I thought for Mobs to be. Warden and Sculk-Guard
My favorite dimension

With a super
Warden
new sculk mobs like sculk lizard, sculk bird, and sculk skeleton
I want Cherrys to grow on them
Same! They also should have cherry villages!
No we are not adding that

I think so too going there now and days it is just a floating dimension in nothingness all you can get is a egg that nevers hatches and a eltra it is useless but if it had life it would be more exciting
